result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Beau T. Bostwick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Comply with deferred entry of judgment agreement
Court will reserve right for expungement upon successful completion of probation

Sex offender counseling if recommended and follow through
Counseling as deemed appropriate
No contact with TRW

Count 1 - Deferred for 2 years

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Beau T. Bostwick in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deferred entry of judgment has been complied with.  State has some questions in regards to expungement.  Court reviews file.  Def has been convicted of an additional conviction.  Statement by def.  Court will reserve right for expungement, however will deny expungement at this time for count 2.  Ct 1- def has complied with deferred entry of judgment, dismissed.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Request/Agreement for Modification to Conditions of Probation

Defendant Beau T. Bostwick in court with attorney Amy L. Menzel.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 1:39 pm  Plea agreement.  Amended Information filed.  On ct 1 of amended information.  Plea and judgment to be deferred.  Ct 2 Sentence withheld, probation with conditions.  State requesting 30 days jail.  Counsel free to argue.  Atty Menzel also requesting expungement.  Court will accept amended information.  Ct 1 - Sexual assault of child under 16 - No contest plea.  Ct 2 4th degree sexual assault - no contest plea.  Plea advisement form reviewed.  Constitutional rights and right to jury trial reviewed.   Factual basis for plea.  Victim rights have been complied with. Court reviewed deferred judgment for Ct 1.Deferred for 2 yrs.  Cooperate with law enforcement.  Complete probation.  Court signs.  Sentencing argument presented by Atty Uttke for jail time.  Atty Menzel has filed documents with the court.  Court reviews documents.   Sentencing arguments presented by Atty Menzel for imposed and stayed jail time, or commence later with huber.  Statement by def.  Court orders Sentence withheld, probation  2 yrs.  Sex offender counseling if recommended and follow through    Couseling as deemed appropriate.  Cost.  30 days jail with huber.  Commencing no later than 1-10-15 by 6:00 pm   Court will reserve right for expungement upon successful completion of probation     If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Post conviction rights.  Additional condition  No contact with TRW - DOB 1-3-99  Review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Beau T. Bostwick in court with attorney Amy L. Menzel.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:03 p.m. Def waives prelim. Court reviews prelim rights, finds Def understands and waiver freely made. Court finds probable cause. Information filed. Copy received. Not guilty pleas entered to both counts. Bond remains.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
No contact with TRW    No unsupervised contact with minor females unless family member

Defendant Beau T. Bostwick in court with attorney Amy L. Menzel.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Called at 8:33 am  Complaint received.  Waive reading. Preliminary hearing request however Time limits for preliminary hearing wiaved..  State request signature bond with conditions.  No objections.  Bond set by court with condition.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
